net.sf.appia.protocols.group.events
Class GroupInit

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.core.Event
      net.sf.appia.protocols.group.events.GroupInit

public class GroupInit
extends Event

Event that initializes the Group Communication protocols.
In reality the several Group Communication protocols will only start operating upon receiving the first View event, but the GroupInit is required to create that first view.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Alexandre Pinto
See Also:
View

GroupInit

public GroupInit(ViewState vs,
                 Endpt endpt,
                 java.net.SocketAddress ipMulticast,
                 java.net.SocketAddress[] ipGossip,
                 Channel channel,
                 int dir,
                 Session source)
          throws AppiaEventException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 AppiaGroupException
Creates an initialized GroupInit.

Parameters:
vs - the initial view
endpt - the Endpt of the member
ipMulticast - the IP multicast address, or null
ipGossip - the IP of the gossip service
channel - the Channel of the Event
dir - the Direction of the Event
source - the Session that is generating the Event
Throws:
AppiaEventException - as the result of calling Event(Channel,Direction,Session)
java.lang.NullPointerException
AppiaGroupException

isGenerateIPmulticast

public boolean isGenerateIPmulticast()
Returns true if an IP-Multicast address should be generated.
The generated address is based on the group identification.
Default is false.

Returns:
is an IP-Multicast address to be generated.
